required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of FS VH S/D 4 S-apr for Flap Adherence in Rhytidectomy
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Controlled Phase 3 Study to Evaluate Safety and Efficacy of Fibrin Sealant (FS) VH S/D 4 S-apr (ARTISS) to Adhere Tissues and Improve Wound Healing in Subjects Undergoing Rhytidectomy (Facelift)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to compare the safety and efficacy of FS VH S/D 4 s-apr versus standard of care in adhering tissue and improving wound healing in subjects undergoing facelift.

primary_outcome.measure: Total Volume of Drainage on Each Side of the Face
primary_outcome.description: Total drainage volume collected from each side of the face. One side of face is treated with FS VH S/D 4 s-apr (FS); the other side is treated using standard of care (SoC).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of AEs Related to the Investigational Product (FS VH S/D 4 S-apr)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (day of surgery) through postoperative Day 14

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants' First Occurrence of Hematoma or Seroma by Study Day
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (day of surgery) through postoperative day 14
secondary_outcome.description: Investigators assessed each side of the face for the presence of hematomas and/or seromas

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants With Hematoma/Seroma by Study Day
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (day of surgery) through postoperative day 14
secondary_outcome.description: Investigators assessed each side of the face for the presence of hematoma and/or seroma

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Hematoma/Seroma Anytime During the Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (day of surgery) through postoperative Day 14

secondary_outcome.measure: Investigators' Visual Comparisons of Edema Between the 2 Sides of Face at Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Investigators' assessed which side of the face (FS VH S/D 4 s-apr or Standard SoC) had less edema

secondary_outcome.measure: Investigators' Visual Comparisons of Edema Between the 2 Sides of Face at Day 3
secondary_outcome.description: Investigators' assessed which side of the face (FS VH S/D 4 s-apr or Standard SoC) had less edema

secondary_outcome.measure: Investigators' Visual Comparisons of Edema Between the 2 Sides of Face at Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: Investigators' assessed which side of the face (FS VH S/D 4 s-apr or Standard SoC) had less edema

secondary_outcome.measure: Investigators' Visual Comparisons of Edema Between the 2 Sides of Face at Day 14
secondary_outcome.description: Investigators' assessed which side of the face (FS VH S/D 4 s-apr or Standard SoC) had less edema

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline (Day 0, Preoperative) in Skin Sensitivity on Postoperative Days 3, 7, 14
secondary_outcome.description: Skin sensitivity was measured using Semmes-Weinstein Monofilament set to detect neurological damage. Filament sizes are noted by handle numbers of measuring tools ([handle number = log10(10*force in milligrams applied to skin)], range = 1.65 to 6.65). Detection of filament with smaller handle number = greater skin sensitivity. Smaller change in filament size detection from pre-op to post-op = less impact to recovery of sensation. Smallest filament felt for each side of face was noted. Change in skin sensitivity computed as (Handle Number Postop Day 3, 7, or 14) - (Handle Number Preop Day 0).

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants' Assessment of Side of Face Preference (SoC and FS VH S/D 4) on Postoperative Days 1, 3, 7, 14
secondary_outcome.description: Participants responded to the following question during the side of face preference assessment: "Which side of the face do you prefer? Left side, right side, or no preference?"

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Preferring Either FS VH S/D 4 S-apr or SoC Side of Face - Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Participants responded to the following question during the side of face preference assessment: "Which side of the face do you prefer? Left side, right side, or no preference?"

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Preferring Either FS VH S/D 4 S-apr or SoC Side of Face - Day 3
secondary_outcome.description: Participants responded to the following question during the side of face preference assessment: "Which side of the face do you prefer? Left side, right side, or no preference?"

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Preferring Either FS VH S/D 4 S-apr or SoC Side of Face - Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: Participants responded to the following question during the side of face preference assessment: "Which side of the face do you prefer? Left side, right side, or no preference?"

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Preferring Either FS VH S/D 4 S-apr or SoC Side of Face - Day 14
secondary_outcome.description: Participants responded to the following question during the side of face preference assessment: "Which side of the face do you prefer? Left side, right side, or no preference?"

secondary_outcome.measure: Reasons for Participants' Preferences for Side of Face
secondary_outcome.description: Participants responded to the following questions during the side of face preference assessment: "Which side of the face do you prefer? Left side, right side, or no preference?" If "right" or "left" is chosen, participants were asked "Please mark ALL reasons for choosing this side" Better skin sensation Less numbness Looks better Less bruising Less swelling Less pain Less itching Less tingling Less feeling of "pins and needles" Other ________________ (Free Text)

other_outcome.measure: Participants' Assessment of Difference in Numbness Between Two Sides of Face
other_outcome.description: During each postoperative visit (Day 1, 3, 7, and 14), participants were asked: How would you rate your numbness on each side of your face on a scale of 0-10, with 10 being the worst numbness possible? Difference in scores on a scale = (SoC score) - (FS VH S/D 4 s-apr score) The planned and approved Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) called for a pre-aggregation of the data whereby differences between the two sides of the face were computed first within participants to retain the inherent correlation (pairings) in the measures. Summary statistics and statistical tests were then computed on the differences between the two sides of the face using paired sample tests.

other_outcome.measure: Investigator Preference for Side of Face
other_outcome.description: Investigator reported outcomes data was collected for overall preference for 1 side of face

other_outcome.measure: Investigators' Satisfaction With Quality of Flap Adherence
other_outcome.description: During postoperative visits investigators recorded their satisfaction with the quality of flap adherence for each side of the face (FS VH S/D 4 s-apr (FS) or Standard of Care (SoC) sides of face)

other_outcome.measure: Investigators' Satisfaction With Rate of Healing
other_outcome.description: During postoperative visits investigators recorded their satisfaction with the rate of healing of each side of the face (FS VH S/D 4 s-apr (FS) or Standard of Care (SoC) sides of face)
During postoperative visits investigators recorded their satisfaction with treatment on each side of the face (FS VH S/D 4 s-apr (FS) or Standard of Care (SoC) sides of face)

other_outcome.measure: Investigators' Confidence in Decreased Postsurgical Complications With the Use of FS VH S/D 4 S-apr
Total Aspiration Volumes From Hematomas and Seromas

arm_group.description: One side of face will be treated with the investigational product (FS VH S/D 4 s-apr) as an adjuvant to the standard of care. Please note: Each subject will participate in both arms (investigational product and standard of care) simultaneously, and will serve as his/her own control.

Other side of face will receive standard of care. Please note: Each subject will participate in both arms (investigational product and standard of care) simultaneously, and will serve as his/her own control.

intervention.description: FS VH S/D 4 s-apr will be applied (using spray device provided by Sponsor) to the subcutaneous plane (intraoperative, topical administration) in both the neck and the face area.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female subject is 18 to 75 years of age at the time of screening
- Subject is planned for facial rhytidectomy
- Subject has read, understood and signed the written informed consent
- Subject is healthy, as determined by the investigator using standard pre-operative assessments to include laboratory tests and electrocardiograms
- Subject is of childbearing potential, presents with a negative serum pregnancy test, and agrees to employ adequate birth control measures for the duration of the study
- Subject is willing and able to comply with the requirements of the protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject is indicated for an abbreviated or modified face-lift procedure such as deep plane procedures, minimal undermining procedures, thread lifts, and minimal access cranial suspension
- Subject is indicated for concurrent facial surgeries during the operation (eg forehead plasty,blepharoplasty, rhinoplasty, buccal fat removal, any filler injections including fat injections, lip augmentation, skin resurfacing procedures etc.)
- Subject is indicated for additional procedures to the body during the same operation (eg liposuction, mastoplasty etc.)
- Subject has undergone a prior rhytidectomy surgery
- Subject is an active smoker, as assessed by the investigator
- Subject has a known (documented) bleeding or coagulation disorder
- Subject is being treated with anti-coagulants or with Aspirin (that was not discontinued 7 days prior to surgery)
- Subject has a vascular disorder, cardiovascular disease, and/or uncontrolled hypertension
- Subject has diabetes mellitus with glycosylated hemoglobin (HbA1c) > 7
- Subject is receiving active treatment for a malignancy
- Subject has a connective tissue disorder
- Subject has an active or chronic skin disorder
- Subject has history of Bell's palsy
- Subject has a documented history of pathologically or pharmacologically induced immune deficiency
- Subject has received chronic treatment with immunosuppressive drugs, systemic corticosteroids, or other chronic treatments within 30 days prior to the surgery
- Subject has a known sensitivity to components of FS VH S/D 4 s-apr
- Subject has a known psychiatric disorder (eg, obsessive compulsive disorder, anxiety, eating disorders, etc.)
- Subject has documented healing complications following previous surgeries (eg, hypertrophic scarring)
- Subject is pregnant or lactating at the time of enrollment
- Subject has participated in another clinical study involving an investigational product/device within 30 days prior to enrollment or is scheduled to participate in another clinical study involving an investigational product/device during the course of this study

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were enrolled at 7 clinical sites in the United States, beginning September 2009 and completing in December 2009
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 79 participants were enrolled and screened. 2 were screen failures and 2 requested withdrawal. Therefore, 75 of the 79 enrolled were randomized.

group.title: Facelift Participants
group.description: One side of face will be treated with the investigational product (FS VH S/D 4 s-apr) as an adjuvant to the standard of care (SoC), and the other side of the face will receive SoC alone. Please note: Each subject will participate in both arms (investigational product and SoC) simultaneously, and will serve as his/her own control.

group.title: Facelift Participants
group.description: One side of face will be treated with the investigational product (FS VH S/D 4 s-apr) as an adjuvant to the standard of care (SoC), and the other side of the face will receive SoC alone. Please note: Each subject will participate in both arms (investigational product and SoC) simultaneously, and will serve as his/her own control.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline (Day 0, Preoperative) in Skin Sensitivity on Postoperative Days 3, 7, 14
outcome.description: Skin sensitivity was measured using Semmes-Weinstein Monofilament set to detect neurological damage. Filament sizes are noted by handle numbers of measuring tools ([handle number = log10(10*force in milligrams applied to skin)], range = 1.65 to 6.65). Detection of filament with smaller handle number = greater skin sensitivity. Smaller change in filament size detection from pre-op to post-op = less impact to recovery of sensation. Smallest filament felt for each side of face was noted. Change in skin sensitivity computed as (Handle Number Postop Day 3, 7, or 14) - (Handle Number Preop Day 0).
outcome.population: Full Analysis Data Set = All randomized and treated participants

Detection of filament with smaller handle number = greater skin sensitivity. Smaller change in filament size detection from pre-op to post-op = less impact to recovery of sensation. Smallest filament felt for each side of face was noted. Change in skin sensitivity computed as (Handle Number Postop Day 3, 7, or 14) - (Handle Number Preop Day 0).
measure.population: Full Analysis Data Set = All randomized and treated participants

Summary statistics and statistical tests were then computed on the differences between the two sides of the face using paired sample tests.

measurement_list.measurement: The median is the central value of a series of numbers. This arm has a single data point, i.e. no series of numbers from which to determine a central value.

group.title: Localized to SoC Side of Face
group.description: AE was localized to the side of the face which was treated with standard of care (SoC).

group.title: Localized to FS VH S/D 4 S-apr Side of Face
group.description: AE was localized to the side of the face which was treated with FS VH S/D 4 s-apr

group.title: Non-localized AEs
group.description: AE affected a site other than either side of the face (ie, non-localized AE)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Baxterâs agreements with PIs may vary per requirements of the individual PI, but contain common elements. For this study, PIs are restricted from independently publishing results until the earlier of the primary multicenter publication or 1 year after study completion. Baxter requires a review of results communications (e.g., for confidential information) â¥90 days prior to submission or communication.
